result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek S. Nehls was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Motion and Order to Revoke Huber Privileges
Letter Requesting Amended Judgment-Additional Language

Defendant Derek S. Nehls in court with attorney Andrew J. Burdick.  Defendant Derek S. Nehls in custody.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing to count 1 - DPA case.   State recites joint recommendation:  W/H 3 yrs probation, concurrent to any other -  no use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription; absolute sobriety; restitution as in Ct 2; AODA and follow through;  Huber to be reinstated on conditional jail time in Count 2.    Court accepts the joint recommendation and sentences the defendant accordingly.
Sentencing hearing on August 14, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

Atty Allen gives Court basis for motion to revoke DPA.  Defendant does not contest motion.  Court grants motion to revoke DPA.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 14, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief

Defendant Derek S. Nehls in court with attorney Brian Walter Gleason.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State recites joint recommendation:  Ct 2 - amended to 943.20(1)(a) - Misd.  Ct 1 - DPA 30 mo.  Ct 2 - W/H 30 mo probation - 5 mo condition time, consecutive to any other jail sentence(s), 10 hrs community service, AODA & follow through recommendations, random UAs, DNA submission if not previously submitted, no use or possession of any controlled substances with a valid precription, costs, restitution = $4583.84 j/s w/ Jason Weiland.    Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant.    Defendant sworn by the Clerk.  Guilty plea given.    Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently enters into the plea agreement and joint recommendation.  Court accepts the joint recommendation and sentences the defendant accordingly.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 15, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Brian Walter Gleason in court via phone.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court hears from Atty Gleason, request for Richland County cases to resolve first (hearing set in July).  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 15, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

ADA Allen appears for State.  No appearance by Defendant nor his atty.  Court calls Atty Gleason and leaves message.  Court calls Richland Co. jail and talks to defendant.  Will wait to hear from Gleason and then status will be set.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Status conference on May 26, 2017 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Derek S. Nehls in court, via video, with attorney Peter A. Bartelt.  Defendant Derek S. Nehls in custody.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No objection to video appeareance.  Atty Bartelt addresses his motion to withdraw as counsel and makes record of defendant's dissatisfaction with representation.  Atty Allen advises Court Atty Brian Gleason is said to have been retained and the DAs office is not concerned yet about timeliness of cases.  Atty Bartelt assures this is a true conflict.  Defendant addresses Court and states he has retained Atty Brian Gleason.  Court finds good cause to allow withdrawal and grants motion.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2017 at 09:15 am.
Motion hearing on May 16, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court, via phone.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is in custody at the Richland County Jail.  Court rules that defendant must be present in person to address the motion to withdrawal.  Atty Bartelt will file the motion, via efile, and include the SC rule wtih reasoning for withdrawal.  Motion to be hearing on May 16, 2017, previously set for PLEAS.

Defendant Derek S. Nehls in court.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared, without counsel.  Due to this being the third warrant based on failure to appear, State requests the BW remain and that bond be modified in this case from a signature bond to a $2500 cash bond.  DA Nelson will call the DPD for an officer to transport.  Court remands defendant to be taken into custody.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
